title: New Client Language Switching
body:
Good day,
I was hoping to get some information regarding language switching in the new client. For instance if I want to play on my Latin America North (LAN) account i have to use third party methods (LVOC) to change the language from spanish to english so i understand the buttons on the client. Will the new client allow me to set english as my language regardless of what server I'm playing on?

replies.body:
IT is possible; follow instructions:
1. close your client.
2. Navigate to this folder :   "\League of Legends\Config"
3. Find the file: "LeagueClientSettings.yaml"
(backup up the file if your paranoid)
4. Open the file using a text editor like notepad (right click open with)
5. look for the line:  locale: "en_US" (mine has "en_US but yours may have another language replace with desired language")

here are the language codes:
TEnglish, en_US
Português, pt_BR
Türkçe, tr_TR
English, en_GB
Deutsch, de_DE
Español, es_ES
Français, fr_FR
Italiano, it_IT
Čeština, cs_CZ
Ελληνικά, el_GR
Magyar, hu_HU
Polski, pl_PL
Română, ro_RO
Русский, ru_RU
Español, es_MX
English, en_AU
日本語, ja_JP
Korean, ko_KR

6. Save the file and close it (if u want to prevent patches from resetting the file you can edit the file to 'read only' in properties) 
7. Launch league client voila.
8. Up vote if Helpful.
This doesn't seem to work for the Korean client. -patch 7.14
Work for me. Up vote! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
same!
how you doing ?? @@
logged in just to upvote this hero
Did they change the language code for Korean?

~~probably still "ko_KR"~~

nope I tried that, doesnt work. Also sound does not play ingame for some reason.
Do you know how to install Chinese language{{champion:5}}

You're my savior. {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
Thank you so much i love playing with the Japanese language and when i updated it took it away so thank you for helping out
FINNA SCAM

Unlikely this will be a feature. A region has certain languages it does and *does not* support, so in your example, it's unlikely the new client will add English as an option on the LAN server.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HQd6vzAT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-03T03:46:36.995+0000)
>
> Unlikely this will be a feature. A region has certain languages it does and *does not* support, so in your example, it's unlikely the new client will add English as an option on the LAN server.
> 
> Let me know if you have any other questions.

Why not though? I mean what's the downside of it? If someone enjoys the game in another language why not let him? Blizzard for example has this feature on all of it's games. I can't understand why that wouldn't be possible here.

This is what makes me and us upset. For what reason does it give RIOT a downside?
There are no firm reasonable explanation from RIOT of why this is so.
I just really feel discriminated by the way RIOT treat people who wants or needs other languages.
Almost feel like they have some kind of personal purpose on this decision...

Logged in to upvote this, albeit a few months late. Thank you SO much for reminding me that I could put the file in "Read-Only," such a great semi-permanent fix. If only there was a way to keep this region and language combination after switching between regions - I have friends in NA and friends in LAN, but the Spanish voices are disgusting and I much prefer English to that nonsense. Literal translations... *shudder* 

> > [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HQd6vzAT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-03T03:46:36.995+0000)
>
> Unlikely this will be a feature. A region has certain languages it does and *does not* support, so in your example, it's unlikely the new client will add English as an option on the LAN server.
> 
> Let me know if you have any other questions.

As for this bit of nonsense, I am pretty disappointed, Targons Blade. LAN and English work perfectly, and it is quite possibly the silliest thing in the world to pretend that English is not of the world's most popular languages. Why would this not be a default in ALL regions is beyond me, but your logic is flawed. This is an easy, inexcusable fix that would hurt RIOT in no way, shape or form. There's literally no reason for it, or at least, no valid reason that RIOT has presented thus far.

Please present this as an idea, it would take a whole 2 days to implement. It's going above and beyond for your fans that makes us happy; a proactive instead of reactive approach. If you guys knew that we did language/region changes in the old client, why wouldn't you think of incorporating it in the new client that you would force upon us?

> [{quoted}](name=EnnuiBum,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HQd6vzAT,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-12-20T18:58:40.537+0000)

Literal translations... *shudder*

> As for this bit of nonsense, I am pretty disappointed, Targons Blade. LAN and English work perfectly, and it is quite possibly the silliest thing in the world to pretend that English is not of the world's most popular languages. Why would this not be a default in ALL regions is beyond me, but your logic is flawed. This is an easy, inexcusable fix that would hurt RIOT in no way, shape or form. There's literally no reason for it, or at least, no valid reason that RIOT has presented thus far.

If you guys knew that we did language/region changes in the old client, why wouldn't you think of incorporating it in the new client that you would force upon us?

RIOT GOT HATED, EAT MY PUMPKINS!
This is one of the dullest responses ever. The decision makes no sense at all.

Doesn't make any sense. There are plenty of Korean/Chinese speaking people in the United States, who play on NA but would rather have their language in the game. Also, it would be helpful because of people studying Chinese/Korean in school.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HQd6vzAT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-03T03:46:36.995+0000)

> 
> Let me know if you have any other questions.

"Let me know if you have any other questions". *Proceeds to ignore all other questions*

Not surprising, trying to get an honest, concise answer out of riot is like trying to get the U.S. government to admit that UFOs crash landed in Roswell. 

Considering it took them the better part of a decade to implement a practice mode which competing games have had for years, I won't be holding my breath waiting for us to have this easy add-on which would take any decent programmer only a couple of minutes to implement.

Don't bother trying to figure out their reasoning. They're just a small fish in a big, corporate pond now. They belong to tencent. If you've ever worked for a company that's in that situation, you'll know that unless some suit sitting in a board room sees dollar signs, nothing will change. Unless a huge number of people got together and threatened to stop buying RP over this, it's not a priority for them.
I logged in just to downvote Targon :)
I have question I can't change English to Korean I don't know the code for Korean, ko_KR can't change to Korean!{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

I thought Riot was supposed to be about "their community", that's what you guys always preach when talking about the game and the things you change to better the experience. I don't see this being a move in that direction though, I should be able to play the game in any language I would like because it gives me the best experience. Not sure how it's inconvenient for you guys to add the language packs to the clients. Guess being about your community is just talking the talk but not walking the walk. FeelsBadMan

I have tried it multiple times now even as an read-only file but the korean client won't update to english. 

Regions do and do not support certain languages but the old client did allow to be changed to english so aparently somewhere in the system the support was still there for english.

For international students abroad it was the perfect solution, eventhough messing with the cfg files may have been an discovered loophole around the system, it was the perfect solution for people with limited knowledge of korean.

Same here. I live in Korea, and right now I have the choice of not understanding the ability descriptions when I try a new champion or dealing with about 200 ms of ping when I play on the American server. It'd be nice if there was a more reliable way to get the client language changed, because both of those options are not great.

Now it works. Just go to RiotGames/League of Legends/Config/LeagueClientSettings.YAML
Edit with txt editor and change the language as you want.

tried to change it by setting the en_GB to ja_JP in the file but nothing happened for me either Sadness ;w;. I will miss hearing Jinx laugh.  :c

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config ---> LeagueClientSettings ( open with wordpad). 
Search for Locale and change en_GB to ja_JP
You're welcome!
doesn't work for me :(

editing this file worked for me "X:\%your_directory%\League of Legends\RADS\projects\league_client\releases\0.0.0.50\deploy\system.yaml"
find your server in this file and and ja_JP to available_locales
that should work
it kicks me straight out of the client when I changed the language to chinese. Do you have a solution for that?
Dont about korean but it surely changed english to french in the EU NE server. About the audio ive found a helpful software. It like the software for the skins, but for voice. It is called LVOC

Google for VO (voice over) packs.
